heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

storm.status: No stormy weather is anticipated.  The last big storm was recorded on 03 October 2025, lasting 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (189°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 10%).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 488 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 688.7m lower than yesterday, 330.3m lower than the past week, 487.7m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 1297m to a maximum of 2830m, averaging 1183.4m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1513.7m and 1671.1m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Clouds will be high, allowing good sunlight.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; you can expect comfortable, mild temperatures. Also, pleasant humidity levels and near calm conditions. Possible light showers, clouds will be high, allowing good sunlight, and a mix of sun and clouds. Similar weather conditions should remain.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
